Package gw.api.util

Class StringUtilJP

java.lang.Object
gw.api.util.StringUtilJP
public final class StringUtilJP extends Object
String utilities for the Japan region.

      public static boolean isHiragana(String s)
      Tests if all letters in a string are hiragana.

      Returns:
      true if all letters in a string are hiragana

    • isKatakana

      public static boolean isKatakana(String s)
      Tests if all letters in a string are zenkaku katakana. Note that hankaku katakana string returns false. U+30FC (Katakana-Hiragana Prolonged Sound Mark) is counted as katakana, but other characters are not.
      Parameters:
      s - input string
      Returns:
      true if all letters in a string are zenkaku katakana

    • hiraganaToKatakana

      Parameters:
      s - a hiragana string
      Returns:
      a katakana string

    • katakanaToHiragana

      public static String katakanaToHiragana(String s)
      Converts each zenkaku or hankaku katakana letter in a string to its hiragana equivalent.
      Parameters:
      s - a katakana string
      Returns:
      a hiragana string

    • toHankaku

      public static String toHankaku(String s)
      Converts all zenkaku letters to corresponding hankaku letters. Hiragana is first converted to katakana before being converted to hankaku letters. As for fullwidth Hyphen, Dash, Minus, ICU library does not convert them into halfwidth, as shown below, because of no corresponding halfwidth character defined in unicode.
      • U+30FC (Fullwidth Katakana-Hiragana Prolonged Sound Mark) -> U+FF70 (Halfwidth Katakana-Hiragana Prolonged Sound Mark)
      • U+FF0D (Fullwidth Hyphen-Minus) into U+002D (Halfwidth Hyphen-Minus)
      • U+2010 (Fullwidth Hyphen) into No conversion
      • U+2015 (Fullwidth Dash) into No conversion
      • U+2212 (Fullwidth Minus) into No conversion
      However, they look same on screen and they should be treated as the same in most of cases. Thus, this function additionally converts the following into Halfwidth Hyphen-Minus:
      • U+2010 (Fullwidth Hyphen) into U+002D (Halfwidth Hyphen-Minus)
      • U+2015 (Fullwidth Dash) into U+002D (Halfwidth Hyphen-Minus)
      • U+2212 (Fullwidth Minus) into U+002D (Halfwidth Hyphen-Minus)
      Note that most of input method editors (FEPs) on Windows show U+FF0D as fullwidth Minus in the candidate list (U+2212 is not shown), but some input method editors on Mac and Android show U+2212 as fullwidth Minus.
      Parameters:
      s - a zenkaku katakana string
      Returns:
      a hankaku katakana string

    • toZenkaku

      public static String toZenkaku(String s)
      Converts all hankaku letters to corresponding zenkaku letters.
      Parameters:
      s - a hankaku katakana string
      Returns:
      a zenkaku katakana string

    • toZenkakuKana

      public static String toZenkakuKana(String s)
      Converts only hankaku katakana letters to corresponding zenkaku letters. Internally, it normalizes letters to Unicode normalized forms. Note that it doesn't convert alphabets, numbers and special characters except:
      • U+FF61 (Halfwidth Ideographic Full Stop)
      • U+FF62 (Halfwidth Left Corner Bracket)
      • U+FF63 (Halfwidth Right Corner Bracket)
      • U+FF64 (Halfwidth Ideographic Comma)
      • U+FF65 (Halfwidth Katakana Middle Dot)
      • U+FF9E (Halfwidth Katakana Voiced Sound Mark)
      • U+FF9F (Halfwidth Katakana Semi-Voiced Sound Mark)
      as their normalized forms are hankaku.
      Parameters:
      s - input string
      Returns:
      a string with all hankaku katakana letters converted into zenkaku katakana letters
